Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeebowes
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel La Demeure. We were a party of 4 couples. The hotel was lovely. Friendly reception staff, a very good breakfast buffet and a comfortable sitting/reading area off reception. Rooms were typically Parisian - small but very clean and comfortable. A short walk takes you to the metro at St. Marcel and the Gare l'Austerleitz is a stones through for the train to Versaille or to and from Charles de Gaulle Airport. It is also only a short walk to Rue Mouffetard with its cafe's, bar and restaurants. Plenty fo shops and restaurants next to the Hotel also. All in all a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “an excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: wales062
Reviews.Content: Demeure in Paris 13e is an excellent experience. Very friendly staff from check in to breakfast preparers, Lovely views from the upper floors - the 5th has balconies towards the Eiffel Tower, magical at night when the Eiffel does its hourly dance. Lovely beds and towels and interesting olive oil soap and sage shampoo. Be sure to book on the internet and avoid the over the top rack rate. The bathrooms are small and cramped but the bedroom struck me as roomier than most Paris hotels. Demeure is well placed for the Jardin des Plantes and the Latin Quarter - it is on the boundary of the 5e. You can walk everywhere. Breakfast features great croissants and baguettes and fabulous jams. All lovely

Reviews.Title: “4 days in Paris at La Demeure...just great!”
Reviews.Author: matna
Reviews.Content: First, the Hotel is situated in a great neighborhood(Latin Quarter area) close to a Metro stop. The rooms were very comfortable with windows that open fully to let in fresh air. We stayed on the 6th floor which had a view of the Eiffel tower. Breakfast was enough to get us going and there was a "New York" style bagel shop 50 feet from the Hotel.The front desk staff were extremely helpful with all our questions and spoke English quite well. They made us feel welcome and they seemed to appreciate us staying with them. I would highly recommend this Hotel. I would stay there again if and when we return to Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kate K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March for three nights with my boyfriend. Was the first time for both of us in Paris. Hotel was an brilliant choice, easy to access from the hotel on the metro from the airport, amazing location in walking distance to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter with great places to eat. So easy to get to other main sights on the metro line. Hotel was lovely, very clean, great size rooms and even a bath. Staff very friendly. Over all amazing stay.

Reviews.Title: “:)”
Reviews.Author: machence
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasent stay at this hotel,loved the room,nice and clean,very cute.Nice people and nice location,if and when I go back will stay there again:)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rosieIreland
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with this hotel and woul stay there again. We visited Paris on a city break and this hotel suited us perfectly.We stayed in room 504 on the top floor, it was a nice room with a large bathoom and was nice and cosy. It had a flat screen TV but limited english channels (only BBC news), not a problem but it would be nice to have one or two more. Staff were friendly. We didnt have breakfast as here is a great bakery across the street. The hotel has limited amenities but it is perfect to use as a base for visiting the city. It is in walking distance of 2 metro stops (Los Gobelins and Place d'Italie). There are nice restaurants nearby (caesars do great pizzas), a supermarket and a lovely bakery for breakfast, theres also a macdonalds if that takes your fancy. It is a quiet area at night and there arent many bars, but the metro is great and you can be virtually anywhere in the city in minutes. I wouldnt consider it to be in he latin quarter as advertised, but you can get the metro there easily (it is a lively area near notre dame but can be quite tourisy). Very easy to get from the airport, get the roissy bus outside the terminal straight into the opera area in the city and then hop on the metro at opera metro station and your only a few stops away from les gobelins. when you exit les gobelins station, walk down the hill and turn right onto boulevard st marcel and the hotel is only is about 5 mins walk away just past the carrefour. Overall i would recommend the hotel and would say here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel in the northern part of the 13th district of Paris was a great place to spend our spring nights. The front desk receptionists were helpful, and did their best to speak to us in both French and English. The hotel rooms were not very large, but then again, most hotel rooms in Europe are small compared to US hotel rooms. Our room was comfortable, and had a cool view looking out over the streets of Paris. The amenities we had in the hotel were par for the course, and served us well. There are plenty of places to eat around the hotel, and there is easy access to the subway as well. There are a few patisseries near by that are very tasty as well. The only complaint I would have about this hotel is that the elevator is small and pretty slow as well, but that is common place in Europe as well, so you get over it pretty quick. After a long day of walking through the Paris streets, it would be nice to not have to walk up flights of stairs though.

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay in a different hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: meddlingmike
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from 2 nights in this hotel, booked purely down to trip advisor reviews and website photos ! The first thing is the location which is ok, but just ok ! The room I booked was 52, a suite and I must say whoever took the web photos could make me look like Brad Pitt ! The chair and sofa just didn't make me want to relax in there, I know it's Paris and I have stayed a few times before but I just felt short changed. I asked to change rooms but was told my room is the best in the hotel ?! We didnt even have a kettle and only had 2 medium towels between us, no water in the room and no fridge, for an advertised €300 per night ? I booked this trip as a surprise for my partners 40th birthday and emailed ahead to get her a bottle of chilled champagne in the room on arrival, this was ignored too ! On the plus side, the night porter was helpful at 3am as we gave up trying to sleep through our radiator noise and the sheets were clean and the bed comfy although my feet were off the end and I'm 5ft 11" tall. We love Paris but this trip put us off visiting for a long time to come, a very so so hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “Small but well appointed and affordable”
Reviews.Author: DeeJay036
Reviews.Content: This a lovely small hotel, walking distance to the metro and i also walked into the Louvre from here. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby. The hotel has a tiny 1-person lift - which i appreciated; and the rooms are also Parisian-tiny! but nonetheless very comfortable, lovely linens, 2 english news channels, and a helpful reception. Breakfast wasn't included in my rate and i wasn't about to cough up 11 or 12 euros for it, but there is a nice patisserie over the road that does pastry, juice and coffee for 4 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: MissMaryMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights while in Paris. We were very happy with out choice. The staff were always very friendly, obliging and helpful, from giving us directions to spontaneous french lessons. The rooms were small, but comfortable and had a view of the Eiffel Tower!. Close to metro stations, so nearly everything was easily accessible. Only breakfast is served in the hotel, but some great cafes and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 63romain
Reviews.Content: Excellent and very helpful staff. In between two Metro stations (‘St Marcel’ or ‘Les Gobelins’, about 5 min walk), easy to connect from Charles de Gaulle airport, a bit painful from Orly airport. Good breakfast. Excellent quality/price ratio. Standard double rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great service”
Reviews.Author: Broken_knee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel following an ambulatory surgery at Clinique de Sport. The staff at the hotel was super nice and helpful. They even bring to my room the ice-pack for my knee each time i needed it. The rooms are cozy, simple, clean and with little details that make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: Peetsie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in an Executive room - room 54 on the top floor. Room was compact as expected, but enough room for nice bed and some space around it, and 1 big window facing the side street. Bathroom was very big due to the shape of the room. Didn't hear much traffic noise. Location was good, plenty of boulangeries and restaurants within a few minutes walk (Cesars Italian and a Thai restaurant (out the hotel door 3 mins walk to the right) were good) and a Carrefour supermarket and another supermarket. Choice of 2 metro stations serving 2 lines about 5 minutes walk away. Taxi to CDG was 50 euro. Staff were friendly. Recommended. TIP: We had a nice meal in restaurant beside the Chapelle de la Sorbonne and then walked at night by the Sorbonne, Pantheon, and strolled down Rue Mouffetard to the hotel in a leisurly 30 minutes

Reviews.Title: “BOUTIQUE PARISIEN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: CanberraSenior
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay(s) at the Hotel La Demeure. We were there on 3 separate occasions during our European holiday, just how it worked out (3 nts, 6 nts and 3 nts). I reckon we got to know it pretty well and they got to know us. Francois, the manager is the Ace, he is very good, very efficient, very helpful, he understands Australians, he visits most years. Yes our room was small and yes the bathroom/toilet was small but it was OK for us, we weren't there all that much. It made us feel as though we were in Paris. Our room looked over Boulevard Saint Marcel, with the opening window providing us with a very nice view of the sun setting next to the Eiffel Tower each night. Boulevard Saint Marcel is not an unpleasant street., The sight of over a thousand roller bladers going past the hotel one Friday evening blowing whistles was a nice surprise. We are easily excited. The breakfast room is very small, let's say cosy but it was fine for us, we are only little things. It was not a lavish breakfast but plenty for us (cereal and yoghart, toast and croissants, scrambled eggs, little sausage thingos, muffins and pastries and cheese and fruit). Don't be mistaken, we can "put it away". With regard to visiting the sites of Paris, we in almost all cases walked, it is no problem for us two seniors but it may not suit everybody. We took different routes, it was interesting walking through places like the markets of Rue Mouffetard. Metro stations are not far away and so is the bus but we made little use of either. We did however, walk up to Austerliztz or whatever (there are two together I think) to travel to Versailles and Gard de Lyons was a very short cab ride away when we used the Eurorail to travel to Milan. Francois stored some luggage for us. Gard de Nord is further away, but it turned out to be a very manageable cab ride when we got the Eurostar to London. The front desk was very helpful with transport and other matters. We used the nearby bus service to travel to Sacre Coeur. As others have advised the lift is very small but it does the job. A bakery is virtually right across the road and a small and a much larger supermarket are very nearby, we used them. A few restaurants are nearby, we enjoyed the place across the road and down a bit to the right towards Gard de Lyons. We liked their pizzas. Jardin des Plantes is a moderate walk and the Luxemburg Gardens was a mile or more away, I suppose. We had a good time at the Hotel La Demeure but we're just simple people from "Downunder". There were a lot of Australians and NZs staying at the hotel. We did as part of a tour spend a couple of nights at another hotel which was much more grand but so was the price.

Reviews.Title: “value for money, clean, good staff & location”
Reviews.Author: campagne-family
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours looking on the internet for a hotel in Paris that would suit our requirements, previous reviews did help us to make our decision, and we were very impressed during our stay. Good location for trains, buses, taxis and close walking distances to attractions and lots of good restaurants, cafes and delicious bakeries. We always felt safe at night while walking in this district named the Latin Quarter. The room and bathroom are small but this should be expected being in Paris, and we were only there to sleep and shower. The room had free Wi Fi and the breakfast was continental with a good selection of choices. The staff were friendly and helpful and Yes! the lift is small, me and my suitcase were the limit :) but the view from our window in our room was fabulous to see the Eiffel Tower especially at night and the locals going by. We will defintely being staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: SimonPSurrey
Reviews.Content: I was recommended to stay at this hotel & after booking directly I managed to obtain a double room for a really good price. I read previous reviews they all sounded pretty good so when I arrived and checked in I was impressed with the friendly reception staff and that made all the difference. The room I had was on the 5th floor, typical small lift..room for 1.5 people..but proudly displaying a tripadvisor certificate!...good size room, no-46 had three windows - corner room and a good size bathroom. Large flat screen television, only BBC World - note for hotel - more english language channels would really help..sky news maybe? Shower was really good, plenty of towels, not disturbed every 30 mins by cleaners... Breakfast fine - plenty of good coffee and usual continental breakfast food choices, decent lounge area and 24hr reception. Outside hotel left or right plenty of restaurants cafe's bistro's and taxi rank 200 yards away and an ATM at HSBC 2 minutes away. Decent location in city centre...id have no hesitation to stay here again... for a 3* probably one of the best i've stayed at in Paris over the years.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon happiness”
Reviews.Author: Naomi T
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Paris as part of our honeymoon in November - the first time either of us had been there - and we were delighted with our choice. The hotel is on a wide boulevard with easy access to taxis, cafes and boulangeries, and within walking distance of a number of landmarks and monuments. The room was small, as expected for Paris, but beautifully appointed and very clean. We loved the firm mattress. Small but absolutely fine bathroom; the shower heads took a little working out (five different nozzles) and the water pressure wasn't terribly strong. Some rooms had a small balcony (ours had a window ledge) from which we could watch the locals go by, which was nice. The soundproofing was great but we found the room rather too well-warmed for our taste, and chose to leave the window open during the night; even so, we had no problems with the amount of traffic and general noise. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a brilliant location with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kellberton
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. Rooms are small but quaint and have an authentic Parisienne feel. Mod cons included an iPhone/pod dock. Room was clean with en suite bathroom, but the bathroom was too small - the toilet was crammed in next to sink. Room overlooked the main road, but excellent soundproofing from big windows which were great to open in the daytime. Lovely looking hotel on the outside. All the staff were very friendly with excellent English and breakfast was brilliant with lots of choice in a lovely little room at the back. Fantastic location near to metro stops, mini supermarkets and good restaurants in a pleasant area - not scary at night. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Small but convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lissie87
Reviews.Content: The room was quite small and charges for an additional cot seemed exorbitant, but it was atmospheric and conveniently located for us. We had trouble opening the door with the key we were given, but the person at the desk eventually came up to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value. A little far from the center, but a fantastic price for a lovely family suite.”
Reviews.Author: winterstreet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our family trip to Paris, and it's a lovely hotel. Our family suite was great. Very comfortable, beautiful new bathroom, and the adjoining bedroom with sliding doors was great. It's a little far from the center of town, but it's very close to the Jardin des Plantes, and if you plan on going to the Paris Catacombs you can walk from there. The neighborhood is quiet, and not touristy at all... a nice break if you're visiting in the summer. Lots of Indian food places nearby, and a good patisserie across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, typical Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stephen B
Reviews.Content: Staff typically French, abrupt, not really interested. Hotel was basic but close to two metro stations and very close to another well known Parisian "distraction" dog poo, why don't these hotels sweep the paths at the front door at least. Stay here if ypu must but don't expect the warm and fuzzy welcome feeling.

Reviews.Title: “good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smileyMerseyside
Reviews.Content: hotel located near 2 metro stations (St Marcel & Campio-Formio) which are both approximately 5 minutes walk away. The hotel is a small hotel offering good value for money,the lift is very small so bear this in mind if you have mobility problems. Bedroom size was on the small size rather dark and a bit claustrophobic but as we were only there for for our 3 night break it was adequate. there is a separte toilet and shower room. Breakfast was included and consisted of small selection of cereal,numerous types of bread,cooked meats cheese yoghurts.the usual continental choice The hotel at the time we stayed was i think doing a refurbishment as our door was very difficult to opaerate as it didnt have a handle on. room safe also dificult to use as in the bottom of wardrobe (very awkward) In all though it was a good base,was clean staff helpful and good value for money would I go again -Yes,for value But :if I wanted a more special place close to the centre if not wanting to use transport all the time I would choice somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Back again...”
Reviews.Author: Ladymann
Reviews.Content: Simple, comfortable, pleasant, exceptional location and nice interiors. I'll be back again. No services as such. Great parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what we expected, but wonderful nonetheless!”
Reviews.Author: Croissant7
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Hotel La Demeure together in mid-June and had a good stay even though it wasn't exactly what we had expected. From the photos the rooms looked beautifully decorated and relatively spacious (for Paris anyway). When we got to our room we did love the way it was decorated (the room looked simple and elegant), but it was TINY. There wasn't much room to walk around the bed and there was almost no room for our suitcases. We ended up just shoving our suitcases under the desk or in the closet to ensure that we wouldn't trip over them when we were walking to the bathroom. Another thing we didn't expect was that this room only had one bed. We had asked for two twin beds rather than one queen bed, but it seems they were out of rooms with twin beds so we had to settle for what they had left. It wasn't a huge deal, but having two beds might have been nicer. That said, the bed was pretty soft and comfortable (despite the fact that some of the pillows were a little lumpy). We had also expected a pretty nice shower based on other reviews that we read and while the shower was more deluxe than most hotel showers I didn't really care for it. The shower had about five different nozzles spraying on me and all of them sprayed pretty hard. It didn't bother me as much that the one spraying my head was intense, but for the ones spraying my chest and stomach I thought it kind of hurt. However, you can turn the extra nozzles off so it isn't a huge problem. One pleasant surprise about the hotel room is that we had a little balcony with a small table and chairs and from it we could see the top of the Eiffel tower! It was very French and beautiful and it was so fun to come home at night after a day of exploring the city and surrounding areas and watch the Eiffel tower sparkle. It made me feel as though the money I spent on the hotel was well worth it! Now, onto other aspects of the hotel. The day staff was very friendly and helpful, but the night staff was less so. Additionally, we were told that the hotel had complimentary wifi, but it didn't. We had to pay one euro per day for unlimited wifi, which isn't bad at all, it just would have been nice to know about it in advance. Lastly, the elevator is probably the smallest one I have ever been inside in my entire life. I would say that only two people can fit in the elevator comfortably and if it's two people with suitcases you might have to take turns. The neighborhood the hotel was in was very pleasant! I really loved it. The hotel was close to two metro stops and was near a few grocery stores and a lot of restaurants and patisseries. My friend and I, two very petite girls, felt very comfortable walking around alone even at night! Across the street from the hotel and down to the left a little bit is a nice creperie that I would recommend to guests staying at the hotel. Their dinner crepes aren't the best in the world, but they're not bad, and their dessert crepes are as good as any. The owner of the creperie is the sweetest man in the world! He hardly knows any English, but is extremely patient with English speaking tourists as they butcher their way through French pronunciations. The owner is originally from Greece so if you're nice to him he might even give you some free ouzo! :)

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: infrequenttraveller5
Reviews.Content: OK, I was VERY nervous about our making accommodations in Paris - first, what part of Paris to stay in, next finding a hotel. It was a couples trip and we left 3 kids behind so this is a once in a lifetime trip. (no one wants to look after our kids for a week...) We loved the latin quarter, and this hotel was fabulous. The rooms were clean, we had a little balcony with a great view. The hotel was quiet. The front desk staff were very kind and patient (and spoke English..) and the location was convenient. I wish I could go back... or stay have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “Great for young family!”
Reviews.Author: JustinInDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife and two-year-old in one of their "Family Suites". Perfect size for us! Couch in sitting room was already set up as a bed and our daughter loved it. There was a refrigerator in the room - I heard a couple complaining about the lack of fridge in the other rooms, but ours had one. Also, there was a bathtub which is good to have after lathering up a toddler in sunscreen. Location was okay. Great, safe feeling, neighborhood, grocery store less than a block, bakeries close by for breakfast pastries, but it's a good walk to the Metro. It is about the same walk to three different stops on different lines, so if you plan ahead it can save you time over a bunch of transfers. Service was excellent. Everyone spoke excellent English and answered any questions I had. Free Wifi, I just had to ask for the password. If I'm in Paris with the family again, I will definitely stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the girls!”
Reviews.Author: WizzingAround
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, while on a girls weekend. The location was perfect for us, and the hotel was more than acceptable. I'd recommend this, if you don't mind using the metro. Lots of shops and bakery's around, so breakfast isn't an issue (if you don't want it at the hotel). We had an Executive room, which I felt was like a standard room, in my eyes - so not sure what a standard would have been like! That was my own negative comment. I would stay here again, without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with great staff, in a nice area- stay here!”
Reviews.Author: fubar479
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Paris, I stayed here for 5 nights. It's a elegant, well-kept hotel, with friendly and helpful staff (who speak English). Our room was modern, spacious, and CLEAN. The bathrooms were very nice too. The location was good too- close to the Metro, and in a sweet little neighborhood (edge of the Latin Quarter). Notre-Dame was a 20-minute walk. In short, I highly recommend Hotel La Demeure. It's well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: EleanorPlantagenet
Reviews.Content: Yes the lift is hilariously small, but this hotel is a gem. Our twin room was exceptionally clean, with a reasonably sized bathroom, and powerful shower. The hotel is within easy walking distance of 3 metro stations, and 3 sets of velib bicycles. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the area pleasant and not too busy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and service”
Reviews.Author: McDoovy
Reviews.Content: We were there on a weekend trip to Paris. The hotel is located is south-eastern part of the city, a short distance away from the heart of Paris. Its within 5 min walk to 2 Metro stations and about a 20 min walk to Notre Dame from here. There are lovely bakeries across the street where you can pick up pastries & coffee for breakfast as the hotel breakfast seems pricey. The staff are very helpful and the rooms are clean and functional. They are, however, on the small side, which is common in the smaller hotels in Paris. There is a minimart and a Carrefour supermarket within minutes of the hotel for picking up bottles of water, etc. A good location if you are looking for a more authentic feel of a city that is not filled with touristy cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: alina_bv
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, it was in a good area, very clean and the staff was very nice and helpful. The price was good, as well. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in residential area with easy access to sights”
Reviews.Author: papercup85
Reviews.Content: I went here for three days with my partner for my birthday. We had requested a room with a nice view for this reason and were given a lovely room on the fourth floor with a balcony that had views of the Eiffel Tower which was very romantic at night when it lit up. We arrived at 11am and check in was 2pm but the hotel kept our bags. The staff were lovely, very helpful and humoured our bad French but they also spoke English. There are two sitting areas in the Foyer and a selection of leaflets and maps and free wi fi. The lift is minute, typical in France. The rooms are a decent size for France with a comfortable full size double bed, side tables and lights, wardrobe space, safe, TV, foot stool seat and desk. There were french windows opening up onto the narrow balcony with chairs and table. The bathroom had a powerful shower with several shower nozzles to get you from all angles! and was fairly big. There were nice toiletries too. We slept soundly and didn't hear any street noise. There are several eateries, bakers, cake shops and a supermarket 5min walk away as well as the metro. Bus stop right outside. Cash machine 5min away. The hotel is within walking distance of Moufftard which has many nice restaurants and bars that stay open until 2am. We paid Around £39 pppn and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty.. More like a 2 star hotel....Do not believe what you read!”
Reviews.Author: LMD01
Reviews.Content: On reading the reviews here, I expected a lot more than what we found on arrival. On a late night arrival we were greeted by a young man who was very ignorant and unhelpful in helping us find our way around - explaining that he did not work there very long. Our room was located on the 4th floor, for those who suffer from claustrophobia the lift is not an option - you can barely fit two people in it with cases. Our room was at the end of a dated and dark hallway. On entry, you could smell the damp in the room and condensation was apparent on the window. Typical Parisian style, you could not swing a cat in the place! The bed otherwise known as a "double" barely gave room for two people to sleep comfortably in and the pillows were just awful. As for the bathroom, it smelt of urine due to a drain throwing up dirty water in the middle of the floor, our shower door was broken, our toilet leaked and you can forget about hot water. We had to run the shower for over ten minutes until the water heated up. Not the ideal location however we did walk through the Latin quarter and towards the champs Elysee, a total of 5.7km. The metro is excellent in Paris and a stop can be found around a five minute walk away. Road noise is very bad, the hotel is located beside a hospital so there is constant sirens. As for the maids waking you up at 08.00am every morning, you can certainly forget about a lie on. No English channels on the TV either and generally a very bad experience. Our safe in the room was broken and when we asked for help, we were fobbed off by the hotel owner - a very grumpy and unhelpful man. Wouldn't stay here again nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Comfortable stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RodKenworthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel La Demeure on Boulevard Saint Marcel in Paris, just on the edge of the Latin Quarter. It was a lovely place to stay, with a clean comfortable room with a lovely window looking out over the boulevard, friendly staff and good breakfasts, and it was located within walking distance of the Seine, Notre Dame and other sites. Les Gobelins Metro station was a 3 minute walk from the hotel, so it was easy to find our way to whatever we wanted to see in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great non touristy, super friendly hotel in non touristy location”
Reviews.Author: MandySydney
Reviews.Content: Hi, I think his is a great value hotel. Located on Metro Line 7 (Les Gobelins) on the right bank this is a small, stylish place with great staff who make your life easy. You can can anywhere in Paris from this place, by metro, or a 10 to 15 Euro cab ride. There are lots of restaurants/bistros about that are full of locals, plus a couple of super markets and boulangeries etc. You can walk to the quirky natural history museum (very amelie) if you want something a litle different. Free wifi in all rooms, a super comfy lounge to wait in if you have to etc. I would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “most helpful and friendly staff, good location (latin quarter). great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: mimicyu
Reviews.Content: the staff and owners (father and son who are at the hotel daily) are amazingly helpful and very professional. the breakfast is delicious. the entire hotel is spotless (the owners and the staff are constantly dusting and mopping!). location is in the latin quarter area, so most of the MUST SEE sites for tourists are relatively close. there is a bus stop practically right in front of the hotel. the METRO (subway) stop is only 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “good location but small and old”
Reviews.Author: xdorax
Reviews.Content: Location is great. with some nice bakery + restaurants. You could walk to Notre dame in maybe 30min. However, the room is smaller and older than expected. It is ok clean but could be better. There was stain on one of our pillow There was free wifi which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: Nikkileee
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was wonderful. Not far from sites of interest, public transport and good food. The staff were exceptionally helpful, polite, friendly and 'tourist friendly' (which is one thing we found can be rare in Europe when you are Australian). Upon arrival we were asked if we there were any tours we would like confirmed on our behalf, which was incredibly generous and surprising. The room and bathroom were comfortable and not too small at all, if you remember that you are in Europe. Breakfast was reasonably good. Only real downside to this hotel was that it is located near the hospital, so the sound of ambulance sirens can, on occasion, be relentless.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in real paris!”
Reviews.Author: Sljamesuk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel set in the Latin quater of paris. Hotel room was the best i have stayed in, in Paris but still small. Ipod docking station was a nice touch!. Location however for us was perfect. Set just outside the 'core' tourist areas we felt like we were in 'real' Paris, not the overpopulated tourist areas. Notre Dame was just twenty minutes walk away via the rue mouffetard - a lovely windy road full of shops, market stalls, bars and restaurants - a route recommended by the the hotel reception. Road that it is situated on has a supermarket, boulangarie and small bars so you are not in the middle of now where. We were over for the Rock en Seine Festival and would recommend this if your over at the time - tube journey to saint cloud took half hour and festival was five mins walk away! Sod camping with that as convience! Overall we loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location, very friendly service”
Reviews.Author: b747sw
Reviews.Content: I was always worried about the service in Paris before I arrived, I'm thrilled to say that the staff here changed my perception. Very friendly and made us feel very welcome. Free WI-FI was a great positive, and close to two metro stations (5 - 10 mins walk), with a great street market only 10 minutes walk away. We had a corner room on the top floor over looking the street, so noise wasn't a major issue (except for the police car sirens as a police station appears to be across the road) I think we got one of the better rooms, but couldn't fault it. The iPod dock is a nice positive. The only fault was that breakfast perhaps was a little bland, but it was complimentary, so can't fault that too much.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Affordable Comfort”
Reviews.Author: dlturner007
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Paris before and found the rooms to be very small. This time my wife and I travelled with our eldest daughter and struggled to find a hotel with three beds, certainly none at a reasonable price. That was until we found this little oasis in the Latin Quarter. It is a small boutique hotel conveniently located a few minutes walk from the metro and very reasonably priced for Paris. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room is average for a 3 * hotel, still smaller than you may be used to in other cities. It was very clean also reasonably quiet from external noise but there is some internal noise with doors slamming and hairdryers etc. elevator is very small 3 people – 1-2 with bags. WiFi was avaiable and was only 4 Euro for our 4 night stay. We would certainly recommend this hotel for the average traveller looking for convenience and affordability with average levels of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Believe it - This is a gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: John_S23455
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in the Hôtel La Demeure and couldn't have been more pleased. The attentive staff at this family run hotel makes you feel as though you are family. It is very evident that they love what they are doing and enjoy assisting their guests in any way they can. The room was small, but adaquate and always clean and comfortable. The AC worked great. Free wifi was a great bonus. Breakfast was included in my rate and was abundant and fresh. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: aew-UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location. Metro Lines are between 10-15mins walk, which was fine for me and my partner. There is a lovely park which has a Dinasor museum as well as a zoo near Gare D' Austlltz station; a nice place to have lunch. (15min walk) We didnt opt in for breakfast at the hotel. We just got croissants , fruit, etc from the shops. There are a few places to eat near the hotel, but we went out into the centre of the city to eat dinner and lunch. The reception area is nice, staff are friendly, although , the owner insisted that next time we book directly from their website as its cheaper, not sure if it was? And a little confusion about vouchers from the online company to pay him??? It is an old building so didnt expect the rooms to be massive, just small and cute. We were on the top floor corner room , room 56. You can see the Eiffel tower, slightly. The hotel is cheaper than other hotels and We had a nice stay. I think that the bad reviews on here are a little old? Most are from 2007. I think the hotel has much improved from those peoples stay. I cant say Ive seen every room in the hotel, but our room was clean, safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: MintieS22
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff. Good location near 2 Metro stations in quiet area. Plenty of local restaurants. Two supermarkets and laundromat nearby. Good breakfast in hotel and clean rooms. Our room on the 6th floor had wonderful view over Paris skyline. We would stay there again. Free Wi Fi.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job.”
Reviews.Author: Brindabellaboy
Reviews.Content: Free wifi is very welcome, service pleasant although I was told that my French needs improving when I tried to say thank you. Service overall is good but hotel is very noisy and difficult to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and convenient location, make this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: teamaustralia
Reviews.Content: The staff could not be more helpful offering tips on the best Paris has to offer. Close to the metro it was a good base for exploring and the breakfast was excellent. The rooms are quite large for Paris and best of all - had an ipod dock.

Reviews.Title: “Paris gem”
Reviews.Author: mistergumby
Reviews.Content: Fantastic place to stay while exploring Paris. 5 minute walk to Les Gobelins Metro, plenty of restaurants etc nearby. Double glazed windows so it's very quiet. Breakfast is simple continental in the dining room. The best thing though, is the service. The hosts are very professional, helpful and they pay attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything About This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Soutahhospitality
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel with my parents and some friends. We loved everything! The staff was amazing, and we spoke with them daily. They constantly gave us directions and advice on where to go and what to see. Breakfast was great every morning, there was free wi-fi in the rooms (which is so rare in Europe it seems) and it was a great location to take the metro anywhere you wanted to go. The area around the hotel had a few great places to eat, and was quiet and beautiful. The room was clean and had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. We will surely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ambience par excellence toute le monde! Great ambassadors for Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Rcubed88
Reviews.Content: We decided to tack 3 nights in Paris onto our Amsterdam to Bucharest river cruise and British Isles tour. Our travel agent picked La Demeure. I expected some pokey, no frills, 'value' hotel. Oh contrare mes amis. Beautiful decore. Friendly, attentive and very helpful owner/managers (father and son). We had a problem with a day tour booking which the son (whose name escapes me) fixed. We were panicking because the travel agent had the wrong hotel as the pickup address. He calmly told us to relax and go have our free breakfast while he spent half an hour on the phone trying numbers in London and Paris. It was all sorted out as we emerged after tea and coffee. I can see why a lot of Australians stay here. It's very central or close to most things (such as the lively Rue Mouffetard, the Jardins des Plantes and the Muséum National de l’Histoire Naturelle. Just don't try walking back from the Seine/Eiffel Tower via Mont Panasse like we did (a bus runs the whole way to the door!). It's much further than the map may look (especially in the Summer heat). Phew slept well that night! Will definitely stay here again. C'est fantastique!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, great area!”
Reviews.Author: wendi
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Demeure Hotel and would certainly recommend it. Have only ever stayed in 7th but this was a lovely area. We are walkers and had no problem walking all over city. Bonus was the wonderful Rue Mouffetard for market/restaurants. Staff was helpful and friendly. Had 2 rooms. Standard double was clean and nicely decorated but typical small Paris room. Superior twin was fabulous. Splurge and ask for room 36..3 big windows with room on corner. Double glazed windows kept it quiet altho we sleep with window open and slept just beautifully. Didn't take breakfast at hotel altho it seemed large but at 10 euros we enjoyed the boulangerie across the street. Book online for good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: sn_ridley
Reviews.Content: My Fiancée and I have just returned from a great trip to Paris, where we stayed at Hotel La Demeure. We would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone; it provides great value, the rooms are spacious by Paris standards, and the staff are fantastic. They speak great English, which was very useful, given that my French is extremely rusty! Whilst the hotel isn't packed full of amenities, it doesn't need them - who goes to Paris to spend most of their time in the hotel! The hotel instead chooses to focus on making sure that what it does provide is done very well; there is free, fast wi-fi available throughout the hotel, and if you don't have a laptop or other means of connecting, there is a computer available to use, again free of charge. We were looking for a good restaurant for Saturday night, so asked the hotel if they could recommend anywhere, giving them parameters of the maximum I wanted to spend per person, that I wanted a French restaurant, and that I didn't want it to be too far from the hotel. They recommended a great place called La Mediterainée, which I would also recommend. All in all, it was a great weekend, and we definitely plan on going back - to Paris, and Hotel La Demeure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Friendly Staff - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: NorthTravel
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. We were there for 8 nights and had a very enjoyable time. Staff was very friendly and helped us with our French when we wanted and spoke English when we were confused. There are very good restaurants in the neighborhood, and the whole area is much less touristy than closer to town center. Transportation is easy - metro is only a couple of blocks away and buses are right in front. It's also within walking distance to most major sites. Stop by Boulangerie De Monge for the best baguettes we found! Neighborhood seemed very safe and friendly. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, so we can't speak to that. We preferred cafe and croissants at a neighborhood cafe. We booked through Orbitz and didn't notice until we got there that Orbitz had booked a triple room. Apparently that meant 3 - single beds. The front desk said we couldn't change so we pushed two together and went with it. Not the most accommodating in that respect. We did encounter one of the front desk staff that was a bit terse (that checked us in) and another that was rude (didn't get his name), but the others more than made up for it. Sahad (spelling?) was the best - he really made the stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay on a romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: ejer222
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for our one year anniversary and had a great time at the Hotel La Demure. The staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was surprizingly comfortable. The shower was small, but it had great pressure and messaging features. The bed was comfortable and had a duvet and plush pillows. The room with the shower is separate from the room with the toilet, but I actually found this to be quite convenient. They have a breakfast avaliable, but we chose to indulge in the local pastry shops near the hotel. All in all I was very happy with the place. It is near the metro and is owned by a father and son which adds a bit of charm that you don't find in chain hotels. Everything was clean and felt very safe. (Try to look on their website and online to find good deals. In the off season you really can get rooms here for a steal. We went in March and paid only 99 Euros per night.)

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: LalaLeeLou
Reviews.Content: We had constant communication through e-mail up to our arrival. So we were confident our room was in fact, available upon our arrival. The hotel was conveniently located a couple of blocks away from Les Gobelins metro stop. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful - taking our bags to the lift and helping us out. They offered maps and business cards (to call in case we got lost). And each evening when we arrived back at the hotel they asked us if we enjoyed our day. The room was cozy, and very very clean. It was not opulent, but it was comfortable. All was in proper working order. I will say, though, that the "romantic bed" was actually two twin beds made up separately, pushed together. However, that didn't stop my husband and I from getting a good nights sleep. ;) I was satisfied with our decision to stay there, and would stay again. PS the restaurant only offers breakfast from 7 to 10 but were accomodating to us when we arrived at 10:30.

Reviews.Title: “Hospital staff and good location near Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Viking-Danes-7
Reviews.Content: We were 7 people (4 adults, 2 teenagers and an infant) and enjoyed our stay at Hotel La Demaure for 4 nights in february 2010. Breakfast was 10 Euro per person - it was relatively simpel but tasteful and convenient when travelling in a group. Our 3 standard double rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The rooms are not spacy but quite normal in Paris and we could squeeze in a baby cot in the largest of the three rooms. There are just a few hundred meters to the nearest Metro station and a lot of nearby restaurants. The staff was always very helpful and offered super service. Definitely a place we can recommend if you want to stay close to the Latin Quarter but in a less noisy location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable room in a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: carlyloulou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Demeure for 3 nights in January and found it to be the perfect match for our needs. Room size was not very large but I prefered this as the ambience felt much more Parisian, romantic and cosy. The room was very well heated which was a necessity as Paris itself was absolutely freezing when we visited. Decor was pleasant enough and our room also came with a TV and ipod docking station. The bathroom, although small aswell, was very clean and warm with a brilliant shower. Towels and bedding were changed daily. The reception is very warm and welcoming, as were all the members of staff we spoke to. The hotel does offer a breakfast service but we never sampled this as the hotel is opposite a fabulous Boulangerie selling delicious pastries from morning til evening. The location of the hotel was also fabulous; on a main street with many cafes for daytime and restaurants for the evening, most of which were very reasonable and attracted a good mix of locals and tourists. This was a massive plus for us as we found that because we weren't near an attraction or the centre that the quality of food and value for money was much better and the general area did not feel at all 'touristy', giving you a much better experience of the Parisian atmosphere. The hotel is also situated in between two metro stations and about 20mins walk away from the nearest RER station and l'Open tour orange line bustop, so is brilliant for getting around the city and fairly easy to reach from the airport. The hotel is also very near to the Jardin des Plantes, which is well worth a visit for the musuems that surround it. You can also catch the blue tour route from here. The only negative I could give for this hotel would be that it was sometimes a little noisy at night. The doors are a bit difficult to open/close and so have a tendency to bang which can be a problem with guests returning late or leaving early. There is also a general murmering coming from the main road throughout the night. However, this was a very small negative and we were normally far too tired to care after walking around Paris all day. I will definately consider staying at this hotel again as we are very eager to get back to Paris once more!

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay any where else! It's like really living in Paris...”
Reviews.Author: TokyoAndrew
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say, the Hotel La Demeure has consistently impressed us in the 6+ times our extended family has stayed there. In fact, after the many times we have stayed in Paris/ visited France, once we found the Hotel La Demeure we have never bothered to book any other hotel since -- every time we visit Paris, I can think of no other place I would rather stay. The rooms are clean, staff are friendly, and same staff have been there for some time so we feel we can rely on them to take care of things while we are visiting. The interiors are chic, neat, and sylish but not too much -- it is not ostentatious. One can tell that the quality level of care that the owners have for the rooms is very high -- the shower, bath were new and very nice; very high tech, looking as if they had be recently renovated. When we wanted a bath for my Japanese mother in law, the management was very accommodating and arranged one for us… Again, we found the rooms to be very clean, very nice. Amenities like shampoo and soap were excellent [I still miss the soap that was provided for the room... if I could, I would even buy that for my shower at home] as well as the robes, which I enjoyed very much, using mine every night. One can tell the owners are taking good care of this building and it's facilities... Not all hotels of this grade and that are in this kind of older building are this well looked-after. Breakfast was good, and we especially noted that the bread, coffee and ham were simple but good quality & most importantly: fresh. Choices at breakfast were limited but this is not unusual in Paris, and La Demeure's breakfast was something we were happy to start our day with. Some of the rooms facing the front have a view of the Eiffel tower, and this is particularly nice in the evenings when we returned from dinner and were enjoying some wine in our rooms. The view was quite nice. We want to come back because it really does feel like one is living in Paris. We've stayed at the hotel over 6 times, and are planning to return this April. We love the neighborhood and every time we visit, we really feel like we are actually part of a 'real' community... not just staying in some tourist area that has no personality or interest. The area/ neighborhood is not flashy or overly touristic, yet there is easy access city center by the Metro, and the hotel is within easy walking distance from great dining and shopping in Rue Mouftard.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous La Demeure delivers quintessential Parisian chic, it's everything and more you'd anticipated in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: BeachbabySydney
Reviews.Content: Visiting Paris has to be one of the greatest experiences ever, everyone knows that. Staying at La Demeure ensured that. Sensational location - you can walk to the Jardins de Luxemborg (or run around them like I did with the locals), you can walk all over the Left Bank, get amongst the markets, you can walk to great restaurants or you can catch the metro pretty much right at the door or the bus if you prefer. You can get to anywhere you want so easily because the staff will give you maps, detailed instructions and will totally guide you in the right direction. They helped us so much, they booked tickets for us at museums so I didn't have to queue, they suggested things I wouldn't have even thought of (like the tour of the Paris Opera) and basically went beyond the call of duty at every opportunity. Amazing service aside, the rooms were more than we expected - they were bigger than elsewhere we have stayed before, had a great outlook and were comfortable, clean and had everything you needed for business or holiday. Bathrooms were great too, none of the French plumbing stories are true here. Completely amazing service though, we're still talking about it and have recommended La Demeure to anyone travelling to Paris since and have had nothing but rave reviews from those who've stayed with them. Hope we get to visit again this year, would be fantastic to make it an annual thing and would definately stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “"THE" Place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: 00travelbug00
Reviews.Content: I used to live in Paris so I know my way around. I now visit about once a year and this family run hotel is the place I keep coming back to. Rooms are gorgeous, clean, good size, good value - so Parisian chic! Great location to see the best parts of the city and friendly staff that speak very good English (which my husband definitely appreciates!) makes staying here always a pleasure. Whether it's your first time visiting the city of love or you are a regular like me, make sure to check out this hotel, c'est magnifique!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The real Paris at a great Price”
Reviews.Author: Travelingman53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the opportunity to stay at an excellent boutique hotel in the famous Latin Quarter of Paris. The rooms were a good size (compared with some of the shoe boxes they try to pass as rooms in other hotels), very clean and provided all the expected services that you require. The father and son owners are a wealth of knowledge when it comes to what is on and what to do in Paris. The stay at Hotel La Demeure topped off a wonderful vacation in the City of Light.

Reviews.Title: “Quarant Neuf!!! Lovely charming hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: ericfm98
Reviews.Content: It was my wife's and I first visit to this enchanting city and we enjoyed every minute of it!! This hotel is perfect for those seeking a comfortable place to sleep and away from the heavy 'tourist' areas. Unlike many serious 'Americans' that proclaim the French to be 'rude' we did not encounter this at all. Hey, if you give an attitude, you'll get an attitude, right? The hotel is located in a perfect area close to St. Germaine and easy access to the metro, banks-atms, cafes, and yes a mall. The area is situated close to many pizzerias/little italy. One of the best pizzas we've eaten. Opt out for the breakfast and walk out into the many cafes to choose from. There is this great crepe place right across the street. I believe 1/4 block going east. Highly recommended... Make sure to ask for room Quarante Neuf!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: vlriley24
Reviews.Content: A 3* hotel with 5* service. I could not fault this hotel in terms of their service and attention to detail. Not only did they pre-book us a table at an amazing local traditional French restuarant (away from the usual tourist hangouts yet close enough to walk), but they also sorted out a change in our booking at the last minute and all in the most courteous and helpful manner. Needless to say that my partner went on to propose to me in that very restaurant! The Manager and his staff were so friendly and helpful throughout our brief stay. Having worked in the UK tourism industry for some time, i think that a lot could be learnt from the way this small hotel conducts itself. I've also previous visited Paris for busines and stayed around the Champs-Elysess where the standards were decidely average. However, this hotel is set within the Latin Quater, away from the tourist trap areas, with a local pedestrianised market street within walking distance and a real sense of the parisian culture. I would not hestiate to reccommend Hotel La Demeure to others and look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: triheels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location with easy access to public transport and the Latin Quarter. The desk staff was very helpful. When my plans changed and I had to leave a day early, the were more than accomodating. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldDiva
Reviews.Content: This is a cute, character laden boutique hotel. Our double room was quite small, but nice enough and we had an excellent view from our window. The bathroom was a fair size and the shower was powerful! The location is great, close to 2 metro stations and in an area with abundant restaurants and cafes. Breakfast was very good. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel very clean and well managed and location is nice”
Reviews.Author: jimmyosmond
Reviews.Content: spent six days in hotel (triple room) never had any problems but breakfast is extra(13 euros) but lots of cafe bars nearby only charging 6 euros which i knew when booking .very clean and great owner/staff that will advise you on any places ,walks etc.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Noisy, Uncomfortable Room - Unhelpful Weekend Staff”
Reviews.Author: ReeTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with "Moochii's" posting of June 1, 2009. I booked this hotel based on the reviews and was EXTREMELY disappointed , which prompted me to write my first and only review. Since I was a female traveling alone I wanted a hotel that promised good service. I arrived on a Saturday afternoon and the person at the desk didn't even come out to help me with my luggage. He didn't even bother to look up as I struggled up the stairs with a large suitcase. When I asked questions he also wasn't very helpful as to where I mgiht go to eat for some company. As "Moochii's" my room was abysmal. The lghting was terrible, the walls were dirty and scratched, there was no clock in the room, the balnket was worn and certainly not soft, and it was extremely noisy (could hear people in the adjoining rooms and in the hallway). The price of the breakfast was not posted anywhere and I too was surprised to be charged for it. The neighborhood is quiet, but dead on the weekends and not all that convenient. I have to say that the staff who came in Monday morning were very friendly, but I was leaving that day. Stay on the Right Bank. Please note: I am not all that particular, but this hotel is not as advertised and does not live up to the positive reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottinTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It's a nice... good value hotel. The rooms were clean and nice, but the staff where what makes it stand out. They're very helpful and polite. I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Jones499
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. Rooms are small by our standards, but the overall atmosphere is pleasant, and the staff are great. Nothing was too much trouble, and the breakfasts were excellent. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ItineraryAus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights of visiting Paris for the first time and loved our time here. The hotel has a beautiful warmth and welcome about it that you automatically feel relaxed. The hotel is operated by a wonderful father and son team who were just so accommodating to every aspect of our stay. We can not say anything negative about our stay here and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a relaxed and comfortable stay with easy access to public transport to see the wonderful sights of Paris. Free Internet access was available to use which was handy, breakfast was always fresh and of a great variety aswell. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately Priced Elegant Small hotel in a quant Parisian Neighborhood,”
Reviews.Author: Smohen
Reviews.Content: I booked La Demeure for a three night stay in Paris with my father and brother, based mainly on price for a Triple. Parisian hotel rooms are well known to be cramped by American Standards, although the room we received was not as bad as others I have seen. There was a notable absence of dressers and little room to store luggage. The bathroom was a little roomier, and the facilities were modern and quite nice, however there was a European shower in a bathtub with no shower curtain. The room was very quiet, although you will hear street traffic if you open the windows. I can say that compared to other hotels I really did not hear the other patrons moving around at all. The lobby was small but elegant, with a nice sitting area where you can cruise the free Wifi and order cocktails. There is electronic music playing from a stereo over their fireplace which was appreciated in my case, but I could see how this might be a negative to older travelers. The staff was very friendly and helpful - they helped us find a local electronic store to buy a needed European adapter and hair dryer. There is 24 hour desk service. The elevator is small and cramped and frequently in use by other patrons, and the stair case is somewhat steep, so with older travelers you may want to request a room on the 1st Etage. We were on the 4th floor and mostly used the stairs. The free wifi was readily available, but somewhat difficult to get in our room. One great negative that you should be aware of is the breakfast. The breakfast is $13 Euros a day extra, although there is an option to book with breakfast which I saw on Expedia when I was booking the room and then promptly forgot about. It's a rather standard breakfast with Coffee, Tea, bread, Croissant, Cheese, Ham, Cereal. Honestly, you could do a lot better in the charming surrounding neighborhood. There is an excellent Boulangerie across the street and half a block down, and a great cafe a few blocks away near the subway called Cafe Goblins. They fail to mention this extra charge at check-in, and just mention the location and hours of breakfast, which I felt was somewhat subversive on their part. The location is definitely one of the strong points of this hotel. It's located in the 13th Arrondissment, in a lovely French working neighborhood. There are many cafes and small shops, but not much tourist traffic. The Seine is close by, as is the Jardin des Plants. As a runner, I found it very convenient for running along the Seine. It is within walking distance to Saint Germaine des Pres and the Bastille, as well as the very lovely area around the Sarbonne. In short, the location is great, the hotel is clean, moderately priced, and very nice for what it is. This is no luxury hotel and beware the breakfast surcharge, but very convenient for a nice short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - spring time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KiwiRoss
Reviews.Content: LaDemeure Hotel proved to be the perfect place for my wife and I and our teenage daughter to stay for our two nights in Paris's spring. A good size room with really good bathroom facilities and an awesome balcony feature. Breakfasts exactly right. Near to any shopping you wanted and or trains. Fun lift and an excellent host. We fully recommend this hotel. Sally, Gerald & Stephanie.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing ...”
Reviews.Author: Moochii
Reviews.Content: Having read many great reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor, I felt confident that I had booked into an elegant hotel for a romantic weekend with my partner. Unfortunately this was not the case and our experience at this hotel was so disappointing, it has prompted me to write a review. I don't want to insinuate that other reviews were incorrect, but I do believe people should be aware of 3 issues, which could easily be avoided, but unfortunately for us, ruined our experience at Hotel La Demeure Firstly, our room (Room 30) was fair from satisfactory for the price. It so small we could barely fit both suitcases on the floor. It was incredibly dark and was lit by 3 lamps. There were no duvets - only one woolen scratchy blanket. On one side of the room was the toilet. You then had to cross to another side of the room for the shower and hand-basin - unpleasant! It was so awful we tried to upgrade but unfortunately there were no other rooms available. If you want functional, then this room is fine as you certainly won't be compelled to spend any time beyond sleeping in there. Secondly, be aware that breakfast is charged AND it's expensive. When I booked our accommodation, I booked a 'package' deal with the assumption that breakfast was included. Upon checking the website, there was no mention of the breakfast being charged over and above our 'deal', nor was there any sign on our confirmation print-out, in the bedroom, the lobby or the dining room itself. In fact, upon checking in, the attendant eagerly told us the breakfast times and that if we didn't want to come downstairs, it would be brought up to us. This would not have been a problem except that each day we went down at 9.30am (the dining room shut at 10am) and each morning my partner had muesli and I had only a coffee as there were no croissants left. One particular morning I asked if there were more available and was gruffly told 'no'. Upon checking out, we were informed that we were being charged £13 per person per breakfast. Outrageous!! I explained that firstly, my understanding was the breakfast was included in our deal and secondly, there was no food available when we went to eat. The manager was incredibly rude and insisted that we pay £13 - despite having had only a coffee! He also insisted that our print-out stated that breakfast was not included - which it did not. Lastly, while we found the 2 young men on the front desk absolutely lovely (!!), we found the manger (who dealt with us while checking out) incredibly incredibly rude. As well as accusing me of lying, he then threw my partners bag into a cupboard - quite literally. All in all, it was an incredibly disappointing experience and almost ruined our relaxing weekend away. I'd suggest staying in the backpackers literally just around the corner (Hostel Oops - very new, lovely people and half the price - I really wish we'd stayed there!). If you do decide to stay at Hotel La Demure, perhaps request a room over-looking the street (from what we could tell, they seemed to be lighter) and instead of having breakfast in, venture up the street to the lovely markets (or just get a coffee or croissant from across the road for a tenth of the price) :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Beccaniece
Reviews.Content: My sisters I and went on a long weekend trip to explore Paris. And a minute after entering the hotel we knew that the service would be outstanding. One of my sisters had their bag lost in transit. The front desk manager Francois immediately took her claim ticket and said he would track the bag and be in touch with the airline for us. The room wasn't ready but he took the bags that had made the trip and suggested a few nearby sites and gave us a map with directions. The hotel has a fantastic location a five minute walk to three different metro lines which deliver you to almost any site you need. After seeing some sites and having lunch the room was ready. Spacious enough for three adults and their bags. It was clean and in good condition. The bathroom was also pleasantly large. The room had window with a view of the local area. There was wireless available in the room, you just need to ask downstairs for the password. But be warned this is not for a business traveler looking to do a lot of work, the connection is pretty slow. The next morning on our way out Francois greeted us asked our plans for the day, gave suggestions and delivered the good news my sisters bag was enroute and would be there in the afternoon. All in all we loved the location, comfortable accommodations, and great staff. Francois and Archie in the evening were always available for suggestions, directions and general help. Francois also helped us make dinner reservations. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel because there was a wonderous street a short walk away called Rue Muffetard with all the delicious Paris cuisine you could want. Should be a definite stop on your trip for fresh baked pastries, bread, cheese, wine, fruit, and anything else you would need. I would definitely stay at this hotel again for its location and Francois and his lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: VivekKolkata
Reviews.Content: We booked and reached this hotel on our 2nd day at Paris (day 1 was a disaster at a shady hotel) and was absolutely thrilled on seeing the hotel. It is not central and takes a little bit of time traveling to touristy places in the City but the hotel makes up for it. The receptionist Mr Xavier (as it said on his visiting card) was an abosolute charm since he helped with our heavy luggage and on knowing we were on our honeymoon upgraded us to a better room with a balcony which had view of the Eiffel. the room was small but real cosy and clean. The bathroom was real tiny and nothing to write home about. A real delight was when at 11pm the receptionist on duty helped me warm my "ready to eat packed meal" in the kitchen oven with a warm welcome smile. The experience of this hotel really helped me lighten up the experience of the beautiful city of paris. On day 3 of leaving th hotel Mr Xavier booked our cab for Orly and was kind enough to wake us up and hurry our luggage into the cab to save us from the waiting charges.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and wonderfully helpful staff, excellent Hotel. Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: stevetee510
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at La Demeure recently on the second leg of our Honeymoon in Europe. The Hotel is excellent! It was recommended by our travel agent and lived up to all expectations. We had a fantastic time during our stay in Paris, thanks in no small part to our experiences at the Hotel. The breakfast each morning was typically Parisian, very well presented and delicious! The room was fantastic and the Hotel is perfectlly situated as a basis for all of your adventures around and throughout Paris. Short walk to around 3 Metro stations and bus stops out the front. Amazing staff, who spoke faultless English, which helped these 2 Aussies who with a wedding to plan didnt have much time to learn a great deal of French. Very rude of us i know... Anyhow they were awesome and gave us some great insights into where to eat, shop and the places to see and avoid... All in all our experience at the La Demeure was unbeatable! Could not recommend the Hotel anymore!! Steve.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: chriscooney1
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weekend at La Demeure. The hotel is clean and quiet. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The lounge area is very cosy and relaxing, but I did not really use the lounge, if i stayed longer i would have done. There is a nice small drinks cabinet available and at reasonable prices for a hotel. The hotel is ideally located. The restaurant 'La Canon Les Gobelins' is down the road, on the corner by the 'Gobelins' Metro. I ate there for the two nights and the food was fantastic. Try the Veal - out of this world! Also used to have a coffee etc in the morning there before venturing out on the town. The hotel was a delight to come back to and i will definitly stay there again>.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: begals
Reviews.Content: We got the best customer service even we only stayed one night in La Demeure. Since we need to go to Orleans before checking in, and the front desk allow us to keep our luggage until we back to Orleans. Also, we don't have any communication problem because they got a great English. Location is not too bad and it's close to Latin Quarter and St. Germain. Two supermarkets next to hotel. RECOMMEND TO MY FRIEND!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jannamatthews
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, me and my husband stayed here for our honeymoon. Great shower and clean, it get's cleaned daily. Rooms are not overly big but keeps out Paris traffic noise. The metro isn't far away either, there's also a supermarket nearby and cosy café's. The staff is superfriendly and speaks english well, and the breakfast is yummie although it's not much to chose from, but all you wanna have when you're in Paris is croissants anyway =) Good working airconditioning and heating. We truly loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definitely a recommend”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadAgain008
Reviews.Content: Our first time to Paris on short notice and we were very happy to find rooms available at this hotel during peak season. The staff was great and the rooms clean and comfortable. The bathroom was a bit cramped, but I guess that is normal for Paris. The fact that the hotel has been non smoking for years means that there is no residual smoke odor anywhere, which meant a lot to us. It is a short walk to the wonderful Rue Mouffetard where we had our best meals and the best pastries (by far!, from a small bakery, Le Fournil de Mouffetard). Also 5 minutes walk to the Les Gobelins Metro station. A 25-30 minute walk to Notre Dame. So close to the main sights, but not too close. From our room on the 6th floor we had a view of the Panthenon and the Eiffel Tower. I booked on bookings.com and paid about 140 Eu per night, in peak sanson and short notice. The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is that rating needs to be reserverd for truly exceptional, but we would definitely return to Hotel Le Demeure.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Loztastic
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, really helpfull staff, who all spoke much better english than on previous visits to paris. as a double plus, unlike previous visits, the staff didn't question a same-sex couple wanting a doublr bed (which isn't easy to deal with in broken french) the breakfast was nice - however they were VERy stingy with the butter, and you usually had to ask for more!. one of the two waistesses at breakfast usually forgot to brink milk to to with tea (the french don't really go for it) - so I had to go and nab the milk jug for the ceria! the down sides were *the size of the room (teeny-weeny, but that's usual for paris) *The size of thr bathroom (was too small to be usable, really) *The location (not really in the latin quater, but convenient for restrtaunts on la due moffutart) *the general quality of the rooms - they looked in need of a lick of paint and a "deep cleen" - although they were surface cleen, there was, fror example, a bit of mold in the bathroom and a few patches of peeling paint

Reviews.Title: “Not great location, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: travelgrl24
Reviews.Content: The staff at La Demeure was amazing--they went out of their way to ensure that we were comfortable staying there with our infant. They stowed our stroller downstairs, kept her food in the fridge, etc. When we arrived they said that a small room (that we had booked) would not be big enough but offered us a discounted rate for the larger room. However, the location of the hotel was only alright--not quite in the 5th, but really on the border between the 13th and the 5th. It was much further from the city centre than we had hoped. The room also had a few problems--the telephone wasn't working (they had someone come in when we brought it to their attention, the day we left), and there were some other small problems. Overall, it's a nice place to stay if you are concerned with price and don't care too much about location or being very close walking distance to lots of different stuff. The hotel management and staff make it stand out but next time I would stay somewhere in a better location for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mrperfect33
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is convenient, breakfast satisfying, and the staff is exceptional. I was foolish enough to leave a jacket in the hotel room, they saved it and shipped it to me after I had let some time pass. The room is spartan but the hotel has character and during the French Open there are no deals in Paris. If you are looking for a clean room and plan on spending the majority of your time enjoying the city, this hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous location”
Reviews.Author: WernMachine
Reviews.Content: Everything in Paris involves walking. At the end the day when walking is no longer an option there is alway the metro home. The Hotel Demeure's greatest asset is its location at the "bottom" of the latin quarter. When people say this it means that the hotel is 200 meters from the Rue Moffetard which is a lovely cobbled street that winds its way up to the Pantheon and from there down to Notre Dame and la Cité.The hotel is non-smoking but the room we booked stank of cigarettes, another room was found promptly. The hotel is efficiently run and the duty managers are sharp, streetwise Parisians who are professional and organised. The breakfast buffet is better than average for French hotels, but don't be too fooled by the fish-eye photos of the rooms on the hotel's website, they are Paris sized rooms after all. That said the bathrooms are regular-hotel-sized. The lounge-lobby area is great and the WiFi is free. A 3 minutes bus ride on the 19 to the Gare de Lyon. It's really all good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb La Demeure”
Reviews.Author: JustinianSydneyNSW
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our week's stay at La Demeure conveniently located near the Gobelins Metro. So Parisian and chic ! Rooms clean and comfortable and breakfast ample and varied enough to see you through to lunch and beyond. Manager and staff friendly, helpful and informed. Justinian Sydney NSW

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: danicherry81
Reviews.Content: All i have to say about this hotel is that it's what made my trip in Paris. The Staff is by far the best group of people I've ever meet and extremely helpful. Plus you're walking distants to Rue Mouffetard!!!! If you're looking for more of a city feel and less touristy then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “charming small hotel, extremely charming, knowledgeable staff....”
Reviews.Author: CajunandCanadian
