Reviews.Content: We had the distinct pleasure of staying at the hotel from October 12 through the 20th 2007; Francoise and ALL of the staff were exemplary...patient, informative, very warm & friendly.The hotel being only a short 3 blocks to the metro and a brasserie as well as a block and a half from a local post office was just an extra smile and shake of our head on how fortunate we were. Our room was on the 5th floor, balcony over looking Blvd St Marcel, yup, small, no tub but good shower...our philosophy has always been if you are visiting the area, not your room size but only the cleanliness is important and it was fullfilled here. This trip to Paris was the first trip to Europe for my significant other, who has black & white photography (the now apparently OLD method) in his blood for 35 yrs. Thank you to all of the staff at La Demeure for adding to his and our memories--unforgettable. Martha & Glenn

Reviews.Title: “Location, nice owner, okay room”
Reviews.Author: Captpablo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent three nights at Le Demeure. It's really located on the far end of the Latin Quarter. Nice area, very residential. Nice cafes, ect to eat after a long day. About a 10 minute walk into the hear of the Latin Quarter. Taxi stand about a three minute walk. The hotel itself has a wonderful lounge, free English newspapers, people working the desk were very helpful, spoke much better english than my french. The room was small, normal for french standards. LCD TV, View of Eiffel Tower. Our room was on the street, no noise at all. Bed was okay. Blankets we used, but overall I thought it was pretty normal for Paris. The maid did a great job of straightening the room each day. My only real issue was cost of the room. They have a sister hotel next door which looks also nice. I would recommend staying here, but look at their website directly for best price.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby hotel with a view”
Reviews.Author: soppa
Reviews.Content: Do you trust what is written at the hotel website. Our room was not "individually designed, subtly elegant and supremely comfortable." No even close. It was a small "closet" with a tiny bathroom. The blankets were patched up and worn out. We had an ok view and the service at the front desk was good. Otherwise it was overpriced shabby little hotel at nice neighbourhood. The price should have been ~200 euros but we ended up paying close to 300 euros per room. The price did not really meet with the quality at all. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use this hotel. It will seriously damage your stay!”
Reviews.Author: trevor_kingston
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms in this hotel because we had read the reviews and most were very complimentary. However when we arrived we were told that there had been a problem and that they had cancelled our rooms and booked us into another hotel for that night but that they had rooms for the following night. They then proceeded to show me a cancellation confirmation which had been sent out that day from Venere through whom we had booked yet no one had had the fore-thought to advise us in advance of this 'problem' . While speaking with the manager I was told that the problem was out of their hands and that he would personally pay for our room at the other hotel. When we arrived at the other hotel, they had no record of a booking for us but were able to find us an apartment. This turned out to be not much more than a hostel and our 'apartment' had one bedroom with a double bed plus a put me up in the tiny lounge. This wasn't the experience that we had expected when we book La Demeure. The following morning I rang the Demeure to speak to the manager so that he could settle our room bill as promised and to check that there was no problem for that night. I was then told that they had no booking for us for that night and that the manager would not be in until the Monday. He was also uncontactable. Whilst I was, at first, willing to give them the benefit of the doubt, I really lost all faith in them after this second lie. I should mention that, coincidentally, England were playing South Africa in the rugby world cup on the Friday night and I beleive that the hotel had received a better offer for our rooms. PLEASE DO NOT BOOK INTO THIS HOTEL. If you have the same experience that we had it will spoil your weekend. Whilst we were in Paris for 2 nights which should have given us 2 full days of sightseeing, we spent half the first day finding somewhere else to stay. Not to mention the 2 hours of Friday night that we lost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: utaht
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at La Demeure for 7 days. When we arrived we wanted to change the room type, and this was not a problem. We looked at 2 different rooms, both with balcony and a view of the Eiffel Tower, and selected the larger room. My one negative comment is that the price difference between the larger and smaller rooms was somewhat disproportionate to the size difference, but we still opted for the larger. Hotel rooms in Paris tend to be fairly small, and this hotel was no exception. The size, however, was adequate. We spoke to other tourists about hotel room size and one person, staying at a significantly more expensive property, told us that his room felt overcrowded with just himself in it. The staff, without exception, goes out of the way for their guests. They speak perfect English, and are anxious to help. They are all extremely helpful with directions for taking busses and metros, will check out the hours and prices of various attractions, and make reservations for you. We booked a tour through the hotel, and then needed to cancel it. This was no problem at all, and done with a smile. Prices for breakfast seem a little high, so we opted to eat elsewhere. I did order coffee on several mornings, which was delivered to me promptly. It was also somewhat pricey at 3.50 euros, but the convenience of sitting in the lounge in the morning, checking email with the free WiFi connection, was quite worth it. The location was great, as other reviewers have said. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly affordable hotel, marvelous location”
Reviews.Author: hochy1948
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just had a short break in Paris and spend 2 nights at this hotel, booked on the internet with Eurostar included. The hotel is nice looking and clean, staff can't do enough to help you and are very friendly, especially the man at the front desk. Rooms not luxury but clean and comfortable. Breakfast basic but fresh and sufficient. Location fantastic, very near the Latin Quarter main area, 5-10 minutes walks from 2 metro stations going to Gare du Nord and central areas. If you don't fancy going right in to the heart of tourist Paris there is plenty of lovely places in the area. The Latin Quarter is very buzzy with a fantastic food market, shops and restaurants. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Lovely Parisien Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PerthTraveller7
Reviews.Content: My 25 yr old son & I stayed five nights at this lovely small quaint hotel, arriving there on 30 May evening. The Manager, Fx Cauet, greeted us with great friendliness and showed us to our room which was very large, clean tho simply furnished but with character (very Parisien) & nice view of the area around the hotel. I also remember commenting on the Manager's collection of beautiful teapots & other ornaments in the hotel which reflected on the tasteful decor of the hotel. The breakfast room tho small was cosy & the breakfast was substantial with fresh croissants, ham, cheese & a variety of cakes & of course, individual pots of hot tea & coffee as requested. The hotel is walking distance to metros & not far from Chinatown, the Latin Quarter area & several nice cafes. A cafe worth going to eat at, as highly recommended by Fx Cauet, is Le Pot O'Lait creperie located not far from the hotel. We had dinner there two nights in a row & had the best crepes (savoury as well as sweet) & the manageress (Marie) was very hospitable. Another great place to eat is Le Canon Les Goblins near the hotel. The meals there were inexpensive & well presented. The Louvre is worth a visit but do buy your entry tickets at the metro kiosk near the Louvre to save being in the queue when you are actually there. Champs Elysses is a definite to check out for great coffees, crepes & shopping! The Latin Quarter located a couple of metro stops from the hotel is worth going to as it is interesting - many eateries/cafes etc. There are also the Paris markets where you can get lovely souvenirs, gifts and antiques & dont forget to pay a visit to opulent Gallerie La Fayette for some jaw dropping window shopping! The only drawback we had at the hotel was on our last evening & the next morning when there was no hot water as the hotel's hot water system had apparently broken down & it was the weekend. We had to opt for cold showers which was unpleasant esp for my son as he had succumbed to the flu then. The hotel apparently booked some rooms in a nearby hotel for their guests to have their hot showers but we werent told about it till check out time. Nevertheless, we were given a complimentary bottle of champagne when we checked out. All in all, it was a very pleasant stay. The staff, particularly the Manager Fx Cauet & the tall, very gorgeous looking evening male staff (unfortunately, I didnt get his name...), were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again & would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: colin65Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The staff from the front desk (Manager) Fx Cauet to the kitchen and cleaning staff were all extremely nice and helpful.Nothing was a problem. As this is a small hotel it is kept immaculate and they pride themselves on this. We stayed for 5 days and went to Lemans for 6 days La Demeure stored a suitcase of ours so we did not have to take it, they also booked our train tickets and rang the hotel in Lemans for us to confirm the booking. They have a qaint little breakfast room, you do not have to have the breakfast as there is cafe's everywhere. We stayed on the top floor and could see the Eiffel Tower and when that sparkles at night you are glad you are on the top floor, so if booking yourself be sure to ask for it. We will definately be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Service Awful!”
Reviews.Author: TravelOrganiser2007
Reviews.Content: When dealing with this hotel I found the staff rude, unhelpful and completely incompetent!

Reviews.Title: “Stop searching now”
Reviews.Author: Joe98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in February. Room was at the rear, quiet, very clean and had a comfortable bed. Buffet breakfast was more expensive than nearby but was eat as much as you like, good quality and of course convenient. The owner was very helpful and spoke good English. The hotel is five minutes walk from two metro stations, and if you like walking, which we do, 25 minutes walk from Notre Dame. We really liked the area, not touristy, just parisiennes going about their daily business. The Rue Moufftard is 10 minutes walk with plenty of good restaurants to choose from, a daily market and a lively bohemian atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “I hope this place doesnt become too popular”
Reviews.Author: Ladymann
Reviews.Content: We stayed here visiting a friend who lives nearby. The staff here are very friendly and the stay here is pretty good. There's a sense that this hotel is loved by its owners and that there is no request too difficult to handle. I have stayed many times in 5* Parisian hotel offerings and generally have, by and large, left these establishements feeling like chewing gun has been stuck to my soul. There's a certain understated style to this place which is both simply stylish and lacking in bourgeois pretension. I will come back. So close to 13ths non tourist restaurants, the tea room at the mosque, Jardin des Plantes etc etc etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with a Sting in the tail”
Reviews.Author: gemmagriffin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights this feb with our baby daughter having read reviews both on this site and the lonely planet. I had paid for the room in full up front when booking and got a special rate, however on leaving we were given an additional bill of €180 for the 4 nights.This was to cover breakfast each morning ,we had not been made aware that this was not included in the quoted price, I was willing to swallow that but I was also charged €17 PER NIGHT for the use of a travel cot. They retail at €50 so basically we covered the cost of the cot and more.It was a bit of a sickener and in my opinion underhanded. I am not in the habit of getting into arguements while on holidays and so I paid it and left. Otherwise the service was good, the room was tiny but clean as was the whole hotel. The location was good in that the metro was very close as is the jardins des plantes & the latin quarter. I would recommend it but I would also recommend a full costing in writing up front and also the largest room that you can afford!! Gemma, Cork, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay there- but needed help and the Staff was Magnificent !”
Reviews.Author: skmmdpc
Reviews.Content: My Family and I were staying in an appartment down the block from La Demeure, and needed to get to the airport at 5:30 am. Since we dont speak French well, we were concerned about making arrangements for a taxi to the airport. Even though we were not staying at the Hotel we mounted up our courage and walked into La Demeure to ask if they would arrange for a taxi. Not only were we met with a smile, but an unbelievable willingness to help a stranger. The Directeur, Mr. Cauet immediately arranged for a pick-up (even though the hotel would have to pay the entire cost of the trip if we did not appear the next morning). We of course arrived at the appointed time, to be greeted by a big hello from the Desk Attendent. He confirmed the taxi was on the way, and asked us to be comfortable in the Salon. The next time we are in Paris- There is no doubt which hotel we will be staying at !!!!!!!!!!!!! Thank you Mr. Cauet ! SKM New York City

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Sand0
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in this hotel to start our european holiday and I can say that it set a great mood for the rest of our trip due to our experience there. The service from the desk staff was fabulous and they were very knowledgeable and also spoke english well. Far better than my french! The hotel itself is well located with a metro station close by and a bus stop just outside the door so accessing all the places we wished to see was easy with a metro pass. We were travelling with our 2 teenage daughters and opted for a quad room. While having 2 rooms, it was small when you have 4 suitcases to include as well but still met our needs. The bathroom was a good size and clean. The hand held shower rose took some getting used to in our bathroom but there were fixed showerheads in other rooms. The in-house continental breakfast was the best we had at any hotel on our trip and the food was always fresh and plenty of it. We found the hotel clean and well maintained and nothing seemed to be a problem to the staff who were friendly and courteous. If you are considering a trip to Paris I would certainly include this hotel on my list as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about La Demeure”
Reviews.Author: Audrey_Melbourne
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to spend over two weeks in Paris in September 2006. I was even more fortunate to stay with the wonderful team at Hotel La Demeure. Every member of staff was a delight to deal with, despite me having extremely limited French! Francois-Xavier Cauet in particular is a wonderful source of different things to do ‘off the tourist trail’ plus where to enjoy the best bouillabaisse. Nothing is too much trouble for the team at La Demeure. My 5th floor room (yes, there’s a lift) was a great size for Paris, with a little balcony and a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower and the Pantheon. The ensuite was bright and clean with a fabulous shower and lovely ‘Damana’ accessories. Breakfast is an excellent array of typically Parisian fare. The best croissants I have ever tasted, washed down with beautifully fresh café au lait. The Latin Quarter location is terrific, Metro lines are very close, plenty of fabulous dining options nearby, including the delightful rue Mouffetard which hosts a wonderful market nearly every day of the week. I cannot recommend this property highly enough. I can’t wait to return! Shona, Melbourne

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kl&cosita
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The rooms were clean, contemporary and quiet. The bed was very comfortable which can be a rarity when traveling. The hotel was close to two metro stops and several good restaurants. The father and son team went above and beyond to make our stay in Paris a memarable one. They were warm and hospitable and we both look forward to returning to Hotel La Demeure

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tritonstrumpet
Reviews.Content: Reviewed many hotels and chose La Demeure. Great location, easy walking distance to Latin Qtr., metro. Rooms were clean, staff was helpful.. however, our phone did not work and had to make international calls from the lobby phone. Grocery store and cafes located steps away...Would stay here again....

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Demeure
HotelInfo.Address: 51 Boulevard Saint Marcel, 75013 Paris, France
